caption:
Table 2. Statistics of CIRR. Each reference-target image pair is 
associated with one annotation.

Table 3. Retrieval performance on CIRR. Best (resp. second-best) numbers are in bold-black (resp. blue).  ? See supplementary material 
on our collection details of human performance. We additionally report the average score over R@5 and RSubset@1, which better reveals 
the overall performance of models (discussed in Sec. 5.1). Note that R@5 accounts for possible false-negatives in the entire image corpus.

Table 5. mAP scores for SoTA methods (and ours) on CIRR. See 
Table 3 (corresp. row numbers) for comparison with Recall.

Table 6. Collection 
interface is shown in

Table 6. Statistics of CIRR with auxiliary annotations. The visual 
contents and the (main) annotation determine whether a pair also 
has auxiliary annotations for Q1-4.
